SEARCH
Module webfx.stack.ui.validation
Package dev.webfx.stack.ui.validation.mvvmfx

Class ValidationStatus

java.lang.Object
dev.webfx.stack.ui.validation.mvvmfx.ValidationStatus
public class ValidationStatus extends Object
This class represents the state of a Validator.

This class is reactive, which means that it's values will represent the current validation status. When the validation status changes the observable lists for the messages will be updated automatically.

Author:
manuel.mauky

  • Method Details

    • getMessagesInternal

      protected javafx.collections.ObservableList<ValidationMessage> getMessagesInternal()
      Intended for subclasses used by special validator implementations. Such subclasses can access the message list with writing accesses (unlike the getMessages() which is read-only. An example for a subclass is CompositeValidationStatus.

    • getMessages

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<ValidationMessage> getMessages()
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable observable list of all messages.

    • getErrorMessages

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<ValidationMessage> getErrorMessages()
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable observable list of all messages of severity Severity.ERROR.

    • getWarningMessages

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<ValidationMessage> getWarningMessages()
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable observable list of all messages of severity Severity.WARNING.

    • validProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyBooleanProperty validProperty()
      Returns:
      true if there are no validation messages present.
      See Also:
      • isValid()

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Gets the value of the valid property.
      Property description:
      Returns:
      the value of the valid property
      See Also:
      • validProperty()

    • getHighestMessage

      public Optional<ValidationMessage> getHighestMessage()
      Returns the message with the highest priority using the following algorithm: - if there are messages with Severity.ERROR, take the first one. - otherwise, if there are messages with Severity.WARNING, take the first one. - otherwise, an empty Optional is returned.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the ValidationMessage or an empty Optional.
